subject: JUnit in a framework
msgSnippet: I d like to run JUnit under an in house framework and I don t know how to do it. Our framework starts services and agents that look something like this: class
messageBody:
I'd like to run JUnit under an in house framework and I don't know how to do it. Our framework starts services and agents that look something like this:

class ExampleAgent implements IAgent {

public static IAgent createAgent(...) { ...}

public void start() {
// Assumption is that this will start the agent in a thread and return.
}
}

Once an agent is started it has access to various services supplied by the Framework; its these services I'd like to unit test. I'd guess that I need to create a IAgent that extends JUnit's TestCase and implements the functionality of JUnit's main methods. I'd also like the tests to run using either JUnit's GUI or its text driver.

Any tips would be a great help. Thanks.
-Christopher Helck
